peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I get a free appraisal?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Your best bet is to check with local real estate agents, as most of them offer free comparative market analyses (CMAs), which give you a rough idea of your home's value. Some banks and lenders also provide free appraisals if you're refinancing or taking out a home equity loan.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: 2 Ways to Get a Free Home Appraisal and Check Your Property Value

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much do antique appraisers charge?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The antique appraisal cost can vary significantly depending on various factors, such as the size and age of the item, the level of expertise required, and the location of the appraiser. However, sellers generally expect to pay anywhere from $50 to $200 for an initial appraisal by a certified appraiser.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How Much Does It Cost To Get an Antique Appraised? - Lion & Unicorn

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I get antiques valued?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Talk to Experts As well as experts you might encounter online, free appraisals and valuations are part of the industry. Visit your local antiques store to talk to a dealer and try to find out if there are any specialists in the type of item you're selling in the local area.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to Value Your Antiques: 4 Helpful Tips - The Hoarde
